Header: The Premier says economy will be cushioned up in the face of fluctuations
Content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says the current government has taken a range of steps to improve countryâ€™s economy. He also said that the government has drawn attention on cushioning up shocks created by currency fluctuation. Premier Wickremesinghe made the comments at a function organized by the Community Medical Experts Association. Dr. Janaki Vidanapathirana was appointed as the new President of the Association. Deputy Minister Dr. Harsha de Silva and several other distinguished people were present at the gathering. The Prime Minister further explained that measures should be taken to increase foreign currency inflow to the country.
